result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles J. Hartleben was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer - Portage County [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Fulltime employment/schooling of at least 30 hours per week and if not, then perform 10 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior authorization. 
No contact with with B.L. unless approved by agent.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
No days jail credit.
To be paid out of 25% of prison wages and if not paid by release, remaining balance shall be paid as a conditon of ES.

of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:06 am 
INCLUDES 14CF966 AND 14CM2071. 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Shari Post. 
Parties are in receipt of amended PSI. Atty Post makes statement - notes deft should be eligible for CIP and SAP. State notes agreement with deft being eligible for CIP and SAP. 
VRCW. 
State notes restitution request. Atty Post stipulates to restitution as requested. 
Argument. Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes finding. 
COURT ORDERS In 14CF966: On Ct. 1>> 6 years imprisonment - 4 years IC and 2 years ES - to run consecutive to all other sentences. 
                                                : On Ct. 2>> 2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES - to run consecutive to all other sentences. 
                                                : On Ct. 5>> 5 years imprisonment - 3 years IC and 2 years ES - to run consecutive to all other sentences. 
COURT ORDERS restitution of $126 be paid out of 25% of prison wages and if not paid by release, remaining balance shall be paid as condition of ES. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of ES on ALL>>assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; fulltime employment/schooling of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; no contact with B.L. unless approved by agent; DNA sample and surcharge. 
COURT FINDS the deft is entitled to NO days jail credit. 
COURT FINDS the deft is eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT remands deft into custody of MCSD for transport to WI State Prison System. 
COURT allows counsel to keep copies of PSI and reminds them to maintain their confidentiality. 
Adj: 10:55 am
Kettle Morriane Correctional
Sentencing hearing on July 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:36 am 
INCLUDES 14CF966 AND 14CM2071. 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Shari Post. 
Date and time set for sentencing hearing. 
COURT questions parties regarding receipt of PSI. Both parties have received copies of PSI. 
COURT questions parties regarding maximum exposure in the PSI. Parties state agreement to Court's understanding regarding maximum exposure. 
COURT questions parties if PSI writer's recommendation may be different given the error regarding maximum penalties. 
State has no objection to proceeding today despite error. 
COURT notes reluctance to proceed due to the error. 
Atty Post makes statement. 
COURT refers PSI back to the dept with instruction that they review the recommendation of the PSI in light of the actual imprisonment being enhanced by 4 years on each felony count and maximum of 2 years on the misd. count.  
COURT instructs attorneys to return their copies of the PSI.
COURT ORDERS PSIs sealed with the notation that they contain inaccurate sentencing information. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to set new sentencing date. 
Adj: 10:44 am
ad Prosequendum
Defendant's Waiver of Right to Trial in Portage County - stj
Criminal Complaint from Portage County
consolidated
Probable Cause Found
Sentencing hearing on May 26, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:17 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF966 AND 14CM2071. 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Shari Post. 

State files consolidated information in 14CF966. 
COURT notes application and consent for consolidation from Portage County Case. 
COURT questions parties regarding consolidation of Portage County Case including need for written waiver of trial in Portage County, and documents supporting a factual basis for plea on Portage County counts. 
Atty Post states she has police reports related to Portage County Case for the court to review. 

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 14CF966. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
COURT advises Atty Post to file written waiver of right to trial in Portage County. 

PLEA HEARING IN ALL. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
In 14CF966: Ct. 3 (Criminal Damage to Property/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Criminal Damage to Property/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 14CM2071: Ct. 1 (Battery/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                       : Ct. 2 (DC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF966: Ct. 1 (Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: PSI to be prepared within 6 weeks of today's date. 
Sentencing Hearing set for May 26, 2015 at 10:30 am in Br. 3. 
Adj: 3:44 pm
